title: Leading a Leap into Imagination
description:
Exploring our inspiring speakers at the KWDC24.
The timetable will be revealed next week.
subtitle: Stay tuned for updates!

speaker1.name: Soohwan Cho
speaker1.title: Swift 6 for all
speaker1.description: Swift occupies a central position in the Apple ecosystem. Let's talk about the newly announced Swift 6.0 and the future direction of Swift!

speaker2.name: Yebin Vivi Kim
speaker2.introduction: Hello, I'm vivi, a developer who loves speaking, listening, and writing 👀👂
speaker2.title: First step to develop visionOS, that starts vividly
speaker2.description: Sharing vivid stories from the first encounter with Vision Pro at WWDC24 to the purchase and development experience. Let`s start together! visionOS 🧑‍🔬

speaker3.name: Sangho Cho
speaker3.introduction: I am contemplating the wise use of SwiftUI.
speaker3.title: Why Your View Stutters (feat. Instruments)
speaker3.description: Introducing the process of detecting and debugging hangs in SwiftUI-based apps using Instruments.

speaker4.name: Pavel Zak
speaker4.introduction: Mobile developer, mentor, Computer graphics enthusiast
speaker4.title: The magic of SwiftUI animations
speaker4.description: Curious about SwiftUI animations? Join me on a swift journey from the basics to advanced topics in the talk full of videos and case studies so when we are done, the first thing you will do is enchant your app with some eye candies!

speaker5.name: Cristian Díaz
speaker5.introduction: Cristian is a Berlin-based humanist and software developer specializing in accessible spatial computing. He began building apps for Apple devices with Xcode version 4. Enrolling in art school with the intention of learning to draw comics, he soon discovered it wasn’t quite what he expected. Cristian’s primary goal is to create innovative, accessible solutions that enhance user experiences, raise awareness, and make technology available to everyone. 🖖
speaker5.title: Exploring Accessible Spatial Interactions
speaker5.description: Every major Apple platform was driven by an innovative input model. And Vision Pro continues that trend, opening the door to potentially becoming one of the most advanced assistive devices until now

speaker6.name: Kohki Miki
speaker6.introduction: Mobile DevOps Engineer @ LY Corp. I work to improve Developer Experience for LINE. A maintainer for some open-sourced developer tools like fastlane, Carthage, XcodeGen, and so on,
speaker6.title: Building Intuitive Developer Tools in Swift
speaker6.description: Create developer tools in Swift! This talk explains how to build intutive developer tools and improve Developer Experience.

speaker7.name: Rudrank Riyam
speaker7.introduction: Writer and developer for Apple Platforms.
speaker7.title: Widgets, Widgets Everywhere and Not a Pixel to Spare
speaker7.description: Interactive widgets evolve across Apple devices in iOS 18, iPadOS 18, watchOS 11, & macOS 15. Learn implementation, App Intents usage, & design tips to create powerful, pixel-perfect user experiences.

speaker8.name: Xu Chi
speaker8.introduction:
Xu Chi, visionOS developer, SwiftGG Evangelist 
Ex ByteDance, Morgan Stanley R&D technical expert
XR and AI enthusiast.
speaker8.title: Drop the Beat - Making games for visionOS with native technology stack
speaker8.description: This session give a brief introduction of making visionOS games with Swift/RealityKit/ARKit

speaker9.name: Jaeeun Lee
speaker9.introduction: I explore the possibilities of technology and write books to lower the entry barriers so that everyone can use it. I hope to explain any complex technology in simple language, and I believe that better results can be achieved through trust rather than pressure. I hope for a world where anyone can develop.
speaker9.title: Designing Next-Generation AI Experiences with Apple Intelligence
speaker9.description: Learn about Apple’s generative AI, 'Apple Intelligence,' unveiled at WWDC24. Analyze the innovative application of deep learning technology in Apple Intelligence and explain its core architecture in depth. Propose ways to design beyond the limits of iOS applications using next-generation AI technology and explore its practical applications. This is an opportunity to think together about the new possibilities that AI will open up for the future of iOS development.

speaker10.name: Changhyeon Yoon
speaker10.introduction: I am a Software Engineer at MIRI D.I.H Co., Ltd., developing the service Miricanvas.
speaker10.title: Monitoring to keep an eye on everything happening in your mobile application
speaker10.description:
It is difficult to check the events occurring in a mobile app. 
In this session, we will introduce how to track issues by checking everything that happens in a mobile app through Datadog, how to improve UI/UX through Session Replay, and how to gain insights by tracking user behavior.

nest.name: Wudu Son
nest.title: Monitoring to keep an eye on everything happening in your mobile application
nest.description:
It is difficult to check the events occurring in a mobile app. 
In this session, we will introduce how to track issues by checking everything that happens in a mobile app through Datadog, how to improve UI/UX through Session Replay, and how to gain insights by tracking user behavior.

speaker11.name: Changwoo Kim
speaker11.title: Design for Everyone
speaker11.description: An inclusive app or game is not only usable by different people, but also welcomes people from diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Discover how you can design inclusive content for your interface, language, imagery, and marketing materials and support the broadest possible range of people with your app or game.

speaker12.name: Jaehun Choe
speaker12.introduction: I am an AI service SW/HW developer. I will cover the philosophy/market trends of Vision Pro's SW/HW and AI development/Apple Intelligence on Vision Pro.
speaker12.title: Implementing AI Companion on VisionOS
speaker12.description: Explore Vision Pro HW/SW technology and market trends, and delve into Apple Intelligence.

speaker13.name: Taehyeon Lee
speaker13.introduction: A developer who wants to inspire the world
speaker13.title: Knowledge gained while working on location-based services
speaker13.description: I will share the knowledge I have gained while working at a company that provides location-based services.

speaker14.name: Jung Kim
speaker14.introduction: An old boy exploring the new world of visionOS from macOS to iOS
speaker14.title: Preparing for the visionOS Era: Human-Spatial Interface
speaker14.description: visionOS is a familiar yet unfamiliar environment. It has become an era where developers need to understand people and space better than users. We will look at the changes from the Macintosh interface to the Vision Pro spatial interface.

speaker15.name: Košir Klemen
speaker15.introduction: Senior iOS Developer at Betashares. I've been trying to make cool apps for 10 years now.
speaker15.title: Prepare Your App for Apple Intelligence
speaker15.description: We've all heard about Apple Intelligence. Brief walktthrough about what it is, and a look at how you can integrate it into your app.

speaker16.name: Subin Kim
speaker16.introduction:
Hello, I am Subin Kim, a Software Engineer. Currently, I am developing servers at Karrot.
I package various packages in the macOS environment or automate configurations, and I would like to share the various experiences I have gained in the process.
speaker16.title: A to Z of macOS Automation
speaker16.description:
Introducing various methods to automate the macOS environment and sharing actual cases and experiences. I will mainly introduce and share how to utilize various technologies provided by macOS, such as Launchd, defaults cli, and AppleScript.
Finally, I will share the current state of my ongoing automation and the insights I have gained.

speaker17.name: Kyunghyun Lee
speaker17.introduction:
Developer-turned-CEO,
I planned and developed the video editing apps 'VLLO' and 'WEILO'.
speaker17.title: Creating User-Centric Software
speaker17.description: To survive in the App Store, you must create user-centric software. I would like to share what I have learned over about 10 years of developing apps in the App Store.

speaker18.name: Joongkyu Park
speaker18.introduction: I want to create software that moves people.
speaker18.title: A System for Friendly Errors in Fintech Apps
speaker18.description: Introducing a system to create friendly errors closest to the user.

speaker19.name: MB KWON
speaker19.introduction:
Before using open source, I try to implement it myself.
Before implementing it myself, I talk about app architecture.
Before talking about app architecture, I discuss functional/object-oriented programming.
Before discussing functional/object-oriented programming, I study iOS architecture.
Before studying iOS architecture, I think about data structures and algorithms.
Before thinking about data structures and algorithms, I find the platform that suits me.
speaker19.title: My app development journey, What developers do.

speaker20.name: Jeff Gu Kang
speaker20.introduction:
I founded Mony Mony, which provides the service Someone, and I am the CTO. 
I started iOS development when the iPhone was first released in Korea. I like kind people with a mania tendency.
speaker20.title: Save Someone: The Great Rating Improvement Operation
speaker20.description: If there are multiple apps with the same purpose in the store, which one would you choose? This session talks about how to stand out in the harsh app market with high ratings.

speaker21.name: Riana Soumi
speaker21.introduction: iOS developer at DeNA, traveler, youtuber
speaker21.title: Meet Swift Testing: Transforming the Way iOS Developers Test
speaker21.description: We will dive into why testing is crucial for robust iOS development, explore Apple’s new Swift Testing library, and compare it to XCTest. I’ll also share insights from my own journey of migrating tests, highlighting key benefits and challenges along the way.

speaker22.name: Yuki Aki
speaker22.introduction: Book Translator, Drawer and Traveler@LY Corporation
speaker22.title: Become an Early Adopter of the Xcode's Next Generation
speaker22.description: Learn how to become an Early Adopter of new Xcode and its Beta, tackle OSS issues, Swift bugs, new APIs, and Swift Assist, and release quickly post-Xcode launch, from experiences in LINE app.

speaker23.name: YongWoon Yun
speaker23.introduction: I am YongWoon Yun, a developer who is happiest when studying development :)
speaker23.title: Say Goodbye to Copying! Write Completely Safe Code with Swift's New Feature
speaker23.description:
Did you know that we have been living in a Copyable world? But beyond the wall, there existed Noncopyable!!
Let's learn about the newly introduced Ownership concept and how to write safe and explicit code :)

speaker24.name: Dai Ming
speaker24.introduction:
iOS developer, previously worked at Alibaba and Didi Chuxing. 
developer of the Yanqi APP and the open-source software SwiftPamphletApp.
speaker24.title: The Evolution of iOS Performance Optimization
speaker24.description: The content focuses on performance optimization strategies related to memory, startup time, and package size. I will present the most effective current solutions. I will also discuss the evolution of these strategies.
